trans-unit.source: Obtains a copy of the window region of a window

seg-source.mrk: Obtains a copy of the window region of a window

target.mrk: Obtains a copy of the window region of a window

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the window whose window region is to be obtained.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the window whose window region is to be obtained.

target.mrk: Handle to the window whose window region is to be obtained.

trans-unit.source: Handle to the region which will be modified to represent the window region.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the region which will be modified to represent the window region.

target.mrk: Handle to the region which will be modified to represent the window region.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of the region that the function obtains. It can be one of the following values

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the type of the region that the function obtains.
It can be one of the following values

target.mrk: Specifies the type of the region that the function obtains.
It can be one of the following values

seg-source.mrk: $NULLREGION - The region is empty.

target.mrk: $NULLREGION - The region is empty.

trans-unit.source: $SIMPLEREGION - The region is a single rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $SIMPLEREGION - The region is a single rectangle.

target.mrk: $SIMPLEREGION - The region is a single rectangle.

trans-unit.source: $COMPLEXREGION - The region is more than one rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $COMPLEXREGION - The region is more than one rectangle.

target.mrk: $COMPLEXREGION - The region is more than one rectangle.

trans-unit.source: 0 The specified window does not have a region, or an error occurred while attempting to return the region.

seg-source.mrk: 0 The specified window does not have a region, or an error occurred while attempting to return the region.

target.mrk: 0 The specified window does not have a region, or an error occurred while attempting to return the region.

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The window region of a window is set by calling the SetWindowRgn function.

seg-source.mrk: The window region of a window is set by calling the SetWindowRgn function.

target.mrk: The window region of a window is set by calling the SetWindowRgn function.

trans-unit.source: The window region determines the area within the window where the system permits drawing.

seg-source.mrk: The window region determines the area within the window where the system permits drawing.

target.mrk: The window region determines the area within the window where the system permits drawing.

trans-unit.source: The system does not display any portion of a window that lies outside of the window region

seg-source.mrk: The system does not display any portion of a window that lies outside of the window region

target.mrk: The system does not display any portion of a window that lies outside of the window region

trans-unit.source: The coordinates of a window's window region are relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area of the window.

seg-source.mrk: The coordinates of a window's window region are relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area of the window.

target.mrk: The coordinates of a window's window region are relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area of the window.

trans-unit.source: To set the window region of a window, call the SetWindowRgn function.

seg-source.mrk: To set the window region of a window, call the SetWindowRgn function.

target.mrk: To set the window region of a window, call the SetWindowRgn function.

target.mrk: Related
